t: John 6
Jesus Feeds the Five Thousand
Some*p time after this, Jesus crossed to the far shore of the Sea of Galilee (that is, the Sea of Tiberias),
and a great crowd of people followed him because they saw the signs he had performed by healing the sick.
Then Jesus went up on a mountainside and sat down with his disciples.
The Jewish Passover Festival was near.
When*p Jesus looked up and saw a great crowd coming toward him, he said to Philip, “Where*r shall*r we*r buy*r bread*r for*r these*r people*r to*r eat?”*r
He asked this only to test him, for he already had in mind what he was going to do.
Philip*p answered him, “It would take more than half a year’s wages to buy enough bread for each one to have a bite!”
Another*p of his disciples, Andrew, Simon Peter’s brother, spoke up,
“Here is a boy with five small barley loaves and two small fish, but how far will they go among so many?”
Jesus*p said, “Have*r the*r people*r sit*r down.”*r There was plenty of grass in that place, and they sat down (about five thousand men were there).
Jesus then took the loaves, gave thanks, and distributed to those who were seated as much as they wanted. He did the same with the fish.
When*p they had all had enough to eat, he said to his disciples, “Gather*r the*r pieces*r that*r are*r left*r over.*r Let*r nothing*r be*r wasted.”*r
So they gathered them and filled twelve baskets with the pieces of the five barley loaves left over by those who had eaten.
After*p the people saw the sign Jesus performed, they began to say, “Surely this is the Prophet who is to come into the world.”
Jesus, knowing that they intended to come and make him king by force, withdrew again to a mountain by himself.
Jesus Walks on the Water
When*p evening came, his disciples went down to the lake,
where they got into a boat and set off across the lake for Capernaum. By now it was dark, and Jesus had not yet joined them.
A strong wind was blowing and the waters grew rough.
When they had rowed about three or four miles, they saw Jesus approaching the boat, walking on the water; and they were frightened.
But he said to them, “It*r is*r I;*r don’t*r be*r afraid.”*r
Then they were willing to take him into the boat, and immediately the boat reached the shore where they were heading.

The*p next day the crowd that had stayed on the opposite shore of the lake realized that only one boat had been there, and that Jesus had not entered it with his disciples, but that they had gone away alone.
Then some boats from Tiberias landed near the place where the people had eaten the bread after the Lord had given thanks.
Once the crowd realized that neither Jesus nor his disciples were there, they got into the boats and went to Capernaum in search of Jesus.
Jesus the Bread of Life
When*p they found him on the other side of the lake, they asked him, “Rabbi, when did you get here?”

Jesus*p answered, “Very*r truly*r I*r tell*r you,*r you*r are*r looking*r for*r me,*r not*r because*r you*r saw*r the*r signs*r I*r performed*r but*r because*r you*r ate*r the*r loaves*r and*r had*r your*r fill.*r

Do*r not*r work*r for*r food*r that*r spoils,*r but*r for*r food*r that*r endures*r to*r eternal*r life,*r which*r the*r Son*r of*r Man*r will*r give*r you.*r For*r on*r him*r God*r the*r Father*r has*r placed*r his*r seal*r of*r approval.”*r
Then*p they asked him, “What must we do to do the works God requires?”
Jesus*p answered, “The*r work*r of*r God*r is*r this:*r to*r believe*r in*r the*r one*r he*r has*r sent.”*r
So*p they asked him, “What sign then will you give that we may see it and believe you? What will you do?
Our ancestors ate the manna in the wilderness; as it is written: ‘He gave them bread from heaven to eat.’”

Jesus*p said to them, “Very*r truly*r I*r tell*r you,*r it*r is*r not*r Moses*r who*r has*r given*r you*r the*r bread*r from*r heaven,*r but*r it*r is*r my*r Father*r who*r gives*r you*r the*r true*r bread*r from*r heaven.*r
For*r the*r bread*r of*r God*r is*r the*r bread*r that*r comes*r down*r from*r heaven*r and*r gives*r life*r to*r the*r world.”*r
“Sir,”*p they said, “always give us this bread.”
Then*p Jesus declared, “I*r am*r the*r bread*r of*r life.*r Whoever*r comes*r to*r me*r will*r never*r go*r hungry,*r and*r whoever*r believes*r in*r me*r will*r never*r be*r thirsty.*r
But*r as*r I*r told*r you,*r you*r have*r seen*r me*r and*r still*r you*r do*r not*r believe.*r
All*r those*r the*r Father*r gives*r me*r will*r come*r to*r me,*r and*r whoever*r comes*r to*r me*r I*r will*r never*r drive*r away.*r
For*r I*r have*r come*r down*r from*r heaven*r not*r to*r do*r my*r will*r but*r to*r do*r the*r will*r of*r him*r who*r sent*r me.*r
And*r this*r is*r the*r will*r of*r him*r who*r sent*r me,*r that*r I*r shall*r lose*r none*r of*r all*r those*r he*r has*r given*r me,*r but*r raise*r them*r up*r at*r the*r last*r day.*r

For*r my*r Father’s*r will*r is*r that*r everyone*r who*r looks*r to*r the*r Son*r and*r believes*r in*r him*r shall*r have*r eternal*r life,*r and*r I*r will*r raise*r them*r up*r at*r the*r last*r day.”*r
At*p this the Jews there began to grumble about him because he said, “I*r am*r the*r bread*r that*r came*r down*r from*r heaven.”*r
They said, “Is this not Jesus, the son of Joseph, whose father and mother we know? How can he now say, ‘I*r came*r down*r from*r heaven’?”*r
“Stop*rp grumbling*r among*r yourselves,”*r Jesus answered.
“No*r one*r can*r come*r to*r me*r unless*r the*r Father*r who*r sent*r me*r draws*r them,*r and*r I*r will*r raise*r them*r up*r at*r the*r last*r day.*r
It*r is*r written*r in*r the*r Prophets:*r ‘They*r will*r all*r be*r taught*r by*r God.’*r Everyone*r who*r has*r heard*r the*r Father*r and*r learned*r from*r him*r comes*r to*r me.*r
No*r one*r has*r seen*r the*r Father*r except*r the*r one*r who*r is*r from*r God;*r only*r he*r has*r seen*r the*r Father.*r
Very*r truly*r I*r tell*r you,*r the*r one*r who*r believes*r has*r eternal*r life.*r
I*r am*r the*r bread*r of*r life.*r
Your*r ancestors*r ate*r the*r manna*r in*r the*r wilderness,*r yet*r they*r died.*r
But*r here*r is*r the*r bread*r that*r comes*r down*r from*r heaven,*r which*r anyone*r may*r eat*r and*r not*r die.*r

I*r am*r the*r living*r bread*r that*r came*r down*r from*r heaven.*r Whoever*r eats*r this*r bread*r will*r live*r forever.*r This*r bread*r is*r my*r flesh,*r which*r I*r will*r give*r for*r the*r life*r of*r the*r world.”*r
Then*p the Jews began to argue sharply among themselves, “How can this man give us his flesh to eat?”
Jesus*p said to them, “Very*r truly*r I*r tell*r you,*r unless*r you*r eat*r the*r flesh*r of*r the*r Son*r of*r Man*r and*r drink*r his*r blood,*r you*r have*r no*r life*r in*r you.*r
Whoever*r eats*r my*r flesh*r and*r drinks*r my*r blood*r has*r eternal*r life,*r and*r I*r will*r raise*r them*r up*r at*r the*r last*r day.*r
For*r my*r flesh*r is*r real*r food*r and*r my*r blood*r is*r real*r drink.*r
Whoever*r eats*r my*r flesh*r and*r drinks*r my*r blood*r remains*r in*r me,*r and*r I*r in*r them.*r
Just*r as*r the*r living*r Father*r sent*r me*r and*r I*r live*r because*r of*r the*r Father,*r so*r the*r one*r who*r feeds*r on*r me*r will*r live*r because*r of*r me.*r
This*r is*r the*r bread*r that*r came*r down*r from*r heaven.*r Your*r ancestors*r ate*r manna*r and*r died,*r but*r whoever*r feeds*r on*r this*r bread*r will*r live*r forever.”*r
He said this while teaching in the synagogue in Capernaum.
Many Disciples Desert Jesus
On*p hearing it, many of his disciples said, “This is a hard teaching. Who can accept it?”
Aware*p that his disciples were grumbling about this, Jesus said to them, “Does*r this*r offend*r you?*r
Then*r what*r if*r you*r see*r the*r Son*r of*r Man*r ascend*r to*r where*r he*r was*r before!*r
The*r Spirit*r gives*r life;*r the*r flesh*r counts*r for*r nothing.*r The*r words*r I*r have*r spoken*r to*r you—they*r are*r full*r of*r the*r Spirit*r and*r life.*r
Yet*r there*r are*r some*r of*r you*r who*r do*r not*r believe.”*r For Jesus had known from the beginning which of them did not believe and who would betray him.
He went on to say, “This*r is*r why*r I*r told*r you*r that*r no*r one*r can*r come*r to*r me*r unless*r the*r Father*r has*r enabled*r them.”*r
From*p this time many of his disciples turned back and no longer followed him.
“You*rp do*r not*r want*r to*r leave*r too,*r do*r you?”*r Jesus asked the Twelve.
Simon*p Peter answered him, “Lord, to whom shall we go? You have the words of eternal life.
We have come to believe and to know that you are the Holy One of God.”
Then*p Jesus replied, “Have*r I*r not*r chosen*r you,*r the*r Twelve?*r Yet*r one*r of*r you*r is*r a*r devil!”*r
(He meant Judas, the son of Simon Iscariot, who, though one of the Twelve, was later to betray him.)
